Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic

Class ClassificationSorter<X,Y>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic.ClassificationSorter<X,Y>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of elements to be sorted
Y - the type of the classification criteria
All Implemented Interfaces:
Classifier<X,Y>, ProcessingSort<X>, Sort<X>, AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BucketSort, LSDStringSort, SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory
public abstract class ClassificationSorter<X,Y> extends SortWithHelper<X> implements Classifier<X,Y>
An abstract class that combines sorting and classification functionality. This class is designed to sort objects of type X while leveraging classification logic to aid in the sorting process. It uses a helper and a classifier function to perform its tasks.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassificationSorter

      public ClassificationSorter(Helper<X> helper, BiFunction<X,Y,Integer> classifier)
      Constructs a ClassificationSorter with the specified helper and classifier function.
      Parameters:
      helper - the helper instance used for sorting operations
      classifier - a BiFunction that determines the classification logic, taking an element of type X and a classification criteria of type Y to produce an Integer result

  • Method Details

    • classify

      public int classify(X x, Y y)
      Classifies an object of type X using classification criteria of type Y. The method increases the lookup count in the helper and then applies the classification logic using the provided classifier function.
      Specified by:
      classify in interface Classifier<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      x - the object to classify
      y - the classification criteria
      Returns:
      the classification result as an integer
      Throws:
      SortException - if the classifier function is not set

    • classify

      public int classify(X[] xs, int i, Y y)
      Classifies an element from an array of type X using a classification criterion of type Y. This method retrieves the element at the specified index from the array, then delegates to the classification logic.
      Specified by:
      classify in interface Classifier<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements of type X to classify
      i - the index of the element in the array to be classified
      y - the classification criteria of type Y
      Returns:
      the classification result as an integer, determined by the classifier logic

    • getClassifier

      public BiFunction<X,Y,Integer> getClassifier()
      Retrieves the current classifier function used for classification. The classifier is a BiFunction that takes an element of type X and classification criteria of type Y as inputs and produces an Integer result representing the classification.
      Returns:
      the classifier function as a BiFunctioninvalid input: '<'X, Y, Integer>

    • setClassifier

      public void setClassifier(BiFunction<X,Y,Integer> classifier)
      Sets the classifier function to be used for classifying objects. The classifier is a BiFunction that takes an object of type X and classification criteria of type Y as inputs and produces an Integer result representing the classification.
      Parameters:
      classifier - a BiFunctioninvalid input: '<'X, Y, Integer> that determines the classification logic

    • convertToBiFunction

      public static <T, V> BiFunction<T,Void,V> convertToBiFunction(Function<T,V> f)
      Converts a Function into a BiFunction where the second parameter is of type Void. The returned BiFunction applies the given Function to the first parameter and ignores the second parameter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to the original Function and the first parameter of the resulting BiFunction
      V - the type of the result produced by the original Function and the resulting BiFunction
      Parameters:
      f - the Function to be converted into a BiFunction
      Returns:
      a BiFunction that applies the given Function to its first parameter and ignores its second parameter, or null if the input Function is null
